quoteLast: She is tall, slim built, and a little stooped; brown hair, blue eyes, long, thin, pale face. Dressed in a full suit of black.
title: Knots Untied; Or, Ways and By-ways in the Hidden Life of American Detectives
author: McWatters, George S.

quoteTime: about seven o'clock in the morning

title: The True Story of Our National Calamity of Flood, Fire and Tornado
author: Marshall, Logan, 1884-1937

quoteFirst: “Well, I’ve had lots of them. I like cats. I had one once that used to wake me up at
quoteLast: every morning as regularly as two minutes past seven came - not an instant before, not an instant after. He turned the trick by jumping up on the bed and looking steadily into my face. Never touched me, you understand.
title: Angel Island
author: Gillmore, Inez Haynes, 1873-1970

quoteFirst: [18] The amazement of the painter is underrated: “You will believe me much nearer heaven upon Mount Cenis than I was before, or shall probably be again for some time. We passed this mountain on Sunday last, and
quoteLast: were near the top of the road over it, on both sides of which the mountain rises to a very great height, yet so high were we in the valley between them that the moon, which was above the horizon of the mountains, appeared at least five times as big as usual, and much more distinctly marked than I ever saw it through some very good telescopes.
title:
Arrows of the Chace, vol. 1/2
being a collection of scattered letters published chiefly in the daily newspapers 1840-1880
author: Ruskin, John, 1819-1900

quoteFirst: By this bridge, on the morning of the 4th, the advanced guard, the rifle brigade and some native troops under Colonel M’Leod, crossed the bridge, and soon found itself fiercely engaged with very large numbers of the enemy, who had crowded into the villages on each side of the road, from which it was found exceedingly difficult to dislodge them. The first shots were fired
quoteLast: , and Sir Garnet Wolseley in his official despatch, dated Coomassie, Feb. 5th, thus describes the rest:--

quoteTime: about seven o’clock in the morning
quoteLast: when we had the good fortune to enjoy one of the most interesting scenes which these regions can possibly afford. Far to our right was a whole herd of elephants, arranged in regular array, like an army of rational beings, slowly proceeding to the water.
title: Travels and discoveries in North and Central Africa, Vol. 3 (of 5)

quoteFirst: _Mar. 9._—At early dawn we continued our journey along the right bank, and
quoteLast: discovered a rapid river about two hundred and fifty yards wide, having two mouths, to which I have given the name of Lawson River, after Mr. Edward Levy Lawson. The water was of a very light colour.
title: Through the Dark Continent, Vol. 2 (of 2)
author: Stanley, Henry M. (Henry Morton), 1841-1904
